result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Portage County DNA Proof of Submission

8:52 AM Defendant Lori A Sankey in court.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney (Atty) Maxwell Bergner in court for Lori A Sankey. Cases 21CM159, 21CM374, 22CM10, and 22CM42.
Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
21CM159 - No Contest
21CM374 Count 1 - No Contest
22CM42 Count 1 - No Contest

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of 21CM159 Count 1, 21CM374 Count 1, and 22CM42 Count 1.
Clerk directed to enter judgment of conviction(s) this date.
22CM10, 21CM374 Counts 2 & 3, and 22CM42 Count 2 & 3 are dismissed and read in.
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is present and approves the agreement as stated. 
ADA Cassidy makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Atty Bergner concurs with the joint recommendation. 

BY THE COURT: 
21CM159
Serve 30 days in jail. 
6 days credit.
Huber for work, counseling, and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
- STAYED - 
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months.
Early discharge after 18 months, if recommended by the Agent
Conditions of Probation: 
-Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within the scope of your employment. 
-AODA & comply with treatment recommendations. 
-No contact with victim unless the  Agent allows.
-Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time. 
-Comply with other assessments or treatments deemed appropriate by DOC or by Agent. 
-Provide DNA sample.
-Pay costs and surcharges including domestic abuse surcharge.

21CM374 Count 1
Serve 60 days in jail, consecutive. 
2 days credit.
Huber for work, counseling, and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
- STAYED - 
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months.
Conditions of Probation: 
Same as 21CM159
Pay costs and surcharges including domestic abuse surcharge.

22CM42 Count 1
Serve 60 days in jail, consecutive. 
zero days credit.
Huber for work, counseling, and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
- STAYED - 
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months.
Conditions of Probation: 
Same as 21CM159
Pay costs and surcharges including domestic abuse surcharge.

20 days to appeal

Pre-trial conference on March 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Filed by Prosecutor.
Pre-trial conference on February 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

01:22 PM Defendant Lori A Sankey in court with Attorney (Atty) Anne Renc appears on behalf of Atty Maxwell Bergner. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly A Cassidy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 21CM374 and 22CM10.

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued on both cases.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on February 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.addlTxt: filed by Atty Maxwell Bergner
Initial Appearance set for January 18, 2022 @ 1:15 p.m. in Br 2

No contact with K.S.H. or her residence 
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol

1:08 p.m.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly Cassidy appears in court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video. 
Attorney (Atty) Taylor Soule appears in court for defendant. 

ADA Cassidy states facts for anticipated charges of Bail Jumping - Misdemeanor and Contact After Domestic Abuse Arrest.
PBT .21
Defendant is eligible for public defender representation.
Atty Soule does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $750 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule objects to the $500 cash bond and states her reasons on the record and would request a signature bond.
Court indicates that some cash is necessary and will set a $500 cash bond with conditions as stated on the record. 

Initial Appearance scheduled for: January 18, 2022  @ 1:15 p.m.  in Branch 2
